learning.description: The first step in the learning process is to consume the material. Do this early on in the week to allow time to deepen your understanding.

strategies.name: Watch all the videos on the first day of the week.
strategies.description: Clear some space in your day and watch all the videos in one day. Overachiever!

strategies.name: Watch all the videos in the first two days of the week.
strategies.description: Divide the videos in half and finish them in the first two days of the week. More time to practice.

strategies.name: Watch all the videos in the first three days of the week.
strategies.description: A measured approach. Divide the videos in three and finish them over three days.

strategies.name: Watch one video a day this week.
strategies.description: Learn a bit each day by watching one video. If there are more than five videos, you may have to double up on some days.

reviewing.description: Once you've watched the videos, it is important to review their contents so that you remember what you watched.

strategies.name: Write down the things that I did not understand in each video.
strategies.description: Keep track of things that you are unsure so that you can ask the right questions later on.

strategies.name: Take notes during or after watching each video.
strategies.description: Take notes about each video soon after watching so that you remember the concepts better.

strategies.name: Review the lecture materials (slides and/or code) after watching each video.
strategies.description: Make use of the provided lecture material to review what the video said will help you to check your understanding.

strategies.name: Summarise what I have learnt after watching each video.
strategies.description: Challenge yourself to summarise the video after watching it to check how much you understood. If this activity is challenging then watch the video again.

practicing.description: Practice is how you solidify what you've learnt in the videos. It is the best way to make sure that you really understand what was taught.

strategies.name: Practice the concepts in the video during or after watching it.
strategies.description: Don't just watch the video, practice the concepts that it teaches on your own or by following along with the video.

strategies.name: Practice the concepts in each video in a project of my own.
strategies.description: Try to use what you've learnt in your own application so that you can apply it more effectively.

strategies.name: Write down my own examples of the concepts in each video.
strategies.description: Challenge yourself to think about your own examples of the things mentioned in the video.

strategies.name: Write down how this week's concepts link to previous things that I've learnt.
strategies.description: Think about the links between your new knowledge and what you already know. How do these work together?

extending.description: Once you've practiced, you can deepen your understanding by speaking to others or finding other sources of information.

strategies.name: Speak to my classmates about the videos this week.
strategies.description: Ask a friend about their learning this week or talk about how yours went.

strategies.name: Speak to the lecturer about concepts that I did not understand in the videos.
strategies.description: Ask the lecturer for help with challenging concepts from this week's videos.

strategies.name: Search the web for extra resources relating to this week's videos.
strategies.description: Find extra online sources to supplement this week's videos. Read them and add them to your resource list.

strategies.name: Find real-world examples of the concepts in the videos.
strategies.description: Think about how the concepts from the videos work in the real-world. Find or brainstorm some examples for yourself.
